rows.text_1: Let’s check in on another family to see how the mother praises her son, {F3_SON_4} during One-on-One Time.

rows.text_2: {F3_MOTHER} : “You found a striped sock and one with dots. Let’s find the socks that match those two.”
{F3_MOTHER} : “Another sock! This one is white. It isn’t easy finding a matching pair. It can be frustrating.”
{F3_MOTHER} : “You are being very patient and looking very hard, {F3_SON_4}. Well done for trying. I feel so happy when you are helping me.”

{F3_MOTHER} : “You found two socks with the same pattern! Well done for looking, {F3_SON_4}! 

Because you helped me so well, I have 5 extra minutes to play your favourite game together.”

rows.quiz_3_feedback_1: That’s right, giving a simple and free reward helps our children to do behaviours that may be difficult for them.
